name: Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (EGPA)
chief_complaint: I've been having severe asthma attacks, rashes, and my hands and feet feel numb.
prognosis: Variable; can be life-threatening if untreated but often manageable with immunosuppressive therapy. Relapses may occur.
description: EGPA (formerly Churg-Strauss syndrome) is a rare systemic vasculitis characterized by asthma, eosinophilia, and necrotizing vasculitis affecting small-to-medium vessels. It typically progresses through three phases: allergic (asthma, rhinitis), eosinophilic (organ infiltration), and vasculitic (vascular inflammation).
